title: How to Plan & Organize a Debate Competition

steps.title: Find out who is participating in the debate.
steps.content: Find out who is participating in the debate. Knowing who is participating allows you to accurately plan and organize how a debate should run. You should be certain to not have too many participants, as this may lead to increased confusion and loudness.

steps.title: Tell your participants to prepare before the debate.
steps.content: Tell your participants to prepare before the debate. Nothing is worse than having several people not know what they are talking about. In order for a debate to run smoothly, tell your participants to please write some key points they would like to discuss. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Structure the debate so everyone gets an equal amount of time.
steps.content: Structure the debate so everyone gets an equal amount of time. It is most common to have a spokesperson for each side of the debate, and to only allow them to speak on behalf of their respective side of the debate. To ensure that not only one person leads each side of the debate, allow for people on each side to switch out every five to ten minutes.

steps.title: Stay on task and honor the time limit for the debate.
steps.content: Stay on task and honor the time limit for the debate. Do not allow a debate to go on and on. The worst thing is for the debate to completely veer off track. This defeats the purpose of the debate, and as an organizer you should strive for the best results a debate can have.

steps.title: Find a pleasant solution to end the debate.
steps.content: Find a pleasant solution to end the debate. A debate should reach an end when both sides reach a conclusion or present all of their opinions and facts. A solution will not always be found, but a compromise or general understanding should mark the end of a debate. [2] X Research source To create an artificial ending: Simply ask for a vote from the general assembly of people on both inputs of the debate groups. If the debate is still split, consider reorganizing at a later date and finishing on a more defined ground.

steps.title: Maintain a respective and neutral environment.
steps.content: Maintain a respective and neutral environment. Do not allow participants (or if applicable audiences) to interrupt your debate. Consider asking such persons to calm down, and if necessary, to leave. If things escalate to violence, consider contacting authorities.
